intro: Stenogyne sessilis var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy leaf stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forests or along stream banks. Its foliage is densely covered with short, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The species is notable for its ecological role in supporting native insect and bird populations.
